2.09 - Material approval of prefabricated vertical drains (PVD).
○ The PVDs shall consist of a continuous plastic drainage core wrapped in a non-woven geotextile material.

○ The geotextile wrap shall be tight around the core and shall be securely seamed in a manner that will not introduce any new materials nor present an obstruction that will impede flow in the channels of the core.
○ PVDs shall be produced by a manufacturer with an in-place quality control program which is monitored by an independent third party testing organization.
Test frequency - At least 4 weeks prior to commencement of PVD installation

3.1.9 - Installation of prefabricated vertical drains (PVD)
PVDs shall be installed after the sand blanket is placed and before the installation of high strength geotextile (basal reinforcement) and the embankment fill.
The proposed locations of the PVDs shall be marked out in accordance with the Drawings.
Test frequency - Each installation of vertical drains
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Vertical drains Installation Checklist
Method/Description - Visual inspection of directional placement, panel length, laps, and damage
Test frequency - During basal reinforcement installation and every 100m² of geotextile installed.
Test frequency - Prior to filling, and every 100m2 of geotextile installed.

Test frequency - Structural Fill - 1 test per material type per earthworks zone, except where outlined in RFI0057
○ Buttress Fill - 1 test per material type per earthworks zone
○ GAP65 - 1 test per material type per structure / location
○ Cement Stabilised GAP65/ Structural Fill - 1 Test per material type per structure/ location
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Test report
3.2.8 - insitu fill testing - In situ moisture content and density
Method/Description - In situ moisture content and density
Test frequency - Structural Fill - 1 test per 1 m lift per 100m length, Heavy compaction and standard compaction areas outlined in RFI00057
○ Buttress fill - 1 test per 200m length Average
○ GAP65 - 4 tests per lift per structure
○ Subsoil Drainage Back fill - 1 test per 500m3 ,
○ Cement Stabilised GAP65 - 4 Tests per 0.5m lift per structure
○ Cement Stabilised Structural fill - 1 test per 0.5m lift per 100m length
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Test report
3.2.9 - insitu fill testing - Undrained shear Strength
Test frequency - Structural fill - 1 test per layer per 1000m2
○ Buttress Fill - 1 Test per layer per 2000m2
○ Cement Stabilised Structural Fill - 1 test per layer per 500m2
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - test report
Test frequency - 435mm above Subgrade formation level to 1.5m depth. 3 tests per 20m chainage evenly across formation pavement width
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Scala Test results

Method/Description - in situ moisture content and density (and/ or air voids) testing of compacted fill material
Test frequency - Surcharged Fills - 1 test at subgrade formation level per 50m length, Cut Fill Transitions - 1 Test per 0.5m lift per 50m length for 1.0m subgrade depth

Method/Description - Benkelman beam or FWD Testing
Test frequency - Surcharged Fills - At subgrade formation level 10m interval in each wheel path
○ Cut Fill Transitions - at three heights: 1.0m, 0.5m and 0m below subgrade formation level 10m interval in each wheel path
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Benkelman Beam or FWD Test results

Test frequency - Test per 5000m2 at subgrade formation level
